description: a(n) = maximum over m of the size of the largest subset of pairwise relatively prime numbers in {m+1, m+2, ..., m+n}.
links: P. Erd≈ës and J. L. Selfridge, Complete prime subsets of consecutive integers, Proceedings of the Manitoba Conference on Numerical Mathematics, Winnipeg (1971), p. 13.
example: a(5) = 4, since {1,2,3,4,5} contains the subset {1,2,3,5} which is pairwise relatively prime and it is impossible for 5 consecutive positive integers to be pairwise relatively prime.
author: _Jeffrey Shallit_, Jul 03 2001
extensions: Name corrected by _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Sep 24 2015
